title: Global cost of living and rising prices - S2

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Let's talk compliance—what do companies actually need to do?

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: Three things. One: disclose how their AI models work. Two: regular safety audits by independent parties. Three: clear user notifications.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Those audits sound expensive.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: They are. Annually for most companies, quarterly for high-risk sectors like healthcare.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Who enforces this?

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: Tech Policy Institute can fine up to 4% of global revenue for violations.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: That's real money.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: It's meant to be. They modeled it after GDPR enforcement, which has been effective.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Will this slow down innovation?

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: Not necessarily. Clear rules can actually help by creating a level playing field and building consumer trust.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: So it's about sustainable growth, not just restrictions.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: Exactly. Better to have rules now than deal with a crisis later.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Good perspective. We'll keep you updated! [WORD_COUNT=165]

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Let's dive even deeper into this topic, because there's so much more to explore here.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: Absolutely. We've covered the basics, but the implications and details are really worth examining more closely.
